intro: Melilotoides korshinskyi, commonly known as the Korshinsky's melilot, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as steppes and rocky areas. It is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
